Package com.tiyb.tev.controller

Class TEVMetadataRestController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiyb.tev.controller.TEVMetadataRestController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api")
public class TEVMetadataRestController
extends java.lang.Object
    REST controller for working with the application's Metadata -- it's settings.
    Author:
    tiyb

        The repo for working with Metadata

    • Constructor Detail

      • TEVMetadataRestController

        public TEVMetadataRestController()

    • Method Detail

      • getAllTypes

        @GetMapping("/types")
public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllTypes()
        GET to return all Types stored in the system. This implementation is very hard-coded, because there are only a specific number of types actually supported by Tumblr. The POST_TYPES member is public, but this API is still useful for JavaScript uses.
        Returns:
        List of type strings

      • getMetadata

        @GetMapping("/metadata")
public Metadata getMetadata()

        GET to return the metadata stored in the system. Only one record will ever be stored in the metadata table, so the API assumes one and only one Metadata object.

        If there is no data in the database, a default object is returned based on Metadata#newDefaultMetadata()

        Returns:
        The Metadata object stored in the database, or an empty object if the table has no data.

      • getStaticListData

        @GetMapping("/metadata/staticListData")
public StaticListData getStaticListData()
        GET to return static data used to populate drop-down lists, for the user to set things like preferred sort order, filters, etc.
        Returns:
        object containing the different lists of strings available

      • updateMetadata

        @PutMapping("/metadata")
public Metadata updateMetadata​(@RequestBody
                               Metadata metadataDetails)
        PUT to update metadata details in the database. Code always acts as if there is one (and only one) record in the DB, even if it's empty; if no record exists to be updated, a new one is created instead. For this reason, the ID is always 1.
        Parameters:
        metadataDetails - The data to be updated in the DB
        Returns:
        The updated Metadata object
